description: Located in the monumental building of Yerevan Brandy Company, the museum chronicles over 130 years of Armenian brandy history since 1887. One of Armenia's most visited venues offering tours in five languages and tastings of world-famous ARARAT brandies.
highlights: History of Armenian brandy production spanning 130+ years
Tours covering grape selection, distillation, aging, and bottling processes
Tasting room experience revealing organoleptic richness of ARARAT brandies
Visited by 30+ world presidents and celebrities like Charles Aznavour, George Clooney
Three tour packages from Standard ($11.96) to Advanced ($26.58) with various tastings
tips: Tours available 9am-8pm daily in Armenian, Russian, English, French, German
Book Standard package for basic experience or Advanced for premium aged brandies
Try ARARAT Apricot and Coffee flavored varieties for unique Armenian twist
Tours end with formal tasting ritual showcasing brandy culture
Located at eastern entrance to Yerevan city center - easy to reach
vibe: Refined and celebratory, where Armenian pride and hospitality flow through every sip, honoring the craftsmanship that made ARARAT brandy world-renowned
